de.unistuttgart.vis.wearable.os.privacy

Class UserApp

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.unistuttgart.vis.wearable.os.privacy.UserApp
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class UserApp
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class represents a Application that makes use of our Garment OS Service. This class saves the package name of the application and the permissions the user has given to this application.
    Author:
    roehrdor
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UserApp(java.lang.String name, int ID)
      Create a new UserApp object with the given name and sets the dafault sensors to the internal Android Sensors

      • sensorProhibited

        public boolean sensorProhibited(int id)
        Check whether the current user settings prohibit the use of the given sensor for the underlying application
        Parameters:
        id - the sensor id
        Returns:
        true if the application is not allowed to use data from the given sensor

      • grantPermission

        public boolean grantPermission(int id)
        Allow the application to use data from the given sensor. This permission is given until it is revoked again by calling revokePermission(int). Note this function will return false if the permission for the sensor is already granted.
        Parameters:
        id - the sensor id
        Returns:
        true if the permission has not been granted yet and the permission has been changed

      • revokePermission

        public boolean revokePermission(int id)
        Revoke the permission for the application to use data from the given sensor. This permission is revoked until it is granted again by calling grantPermission(int). Note this function will return false if the permission for the given sensor has already been revoked and never been granted again.
        Parameters:
        id - the app id
        Returns:
        true if the update has been done successfully

      • denySensorType

        public boolean denySensorType(int flag)
        Allow the user application to use data from the sensor type. If this settings prohibits the use of a sensor type all data from corresponding sensors all requests will be automatically denied. To restrict only a single sensor from multiple sensors for the same type use the function revokePermission(int). The permission for the sensor type is denied until it is granted again by calling the allowSensorType(int) method.
        Parameters:
        flag - the sensor type permission flag to deny usage of
        Returns:
        true if the usage is now denied

      • allowSensorType

        public boolean allowSensorType(int flag)
        Allow the user application to use data from the given sensor type. Only in this state the use of grantPermission(int) makes sense for sensors of the given sensor type. The permission of this sensor type is granted until denySensorType(int) is called with the same argument.
        Parameters:
        flag - the sensor type permission flag to allow usage of
        Returns:
        true if the usage is now permitted

      • sensorTypeGranted

        public boolean sensorTypeGranted(int flag)
        Tests whether the application is allowed to use this type of sensor.
        Parameters:
        flag - the sensor type permission flag
        Returns:
        true if the permission is granted

      • grantActivityRecognition

        public void grantActivityRecognition()
        Grant the application the usage of data gained based on the activity recognition process

      • denyActivityRecognition

        public void denyActivityRecognition()
        Revoke the permission to use data gained based on the activity recognition process

      • activityRecognitionGranted

        public boolean activityRecognitionGranted()
        Return whether the application is allowed to use data gained from the activity recognition process
        Returns:
        true if the application is allowed to use data gained from the activity recognition process

      • toParcelable

        public PUserApp toParcelable()
        Create a parcel able user application object from this one
        Returns:
        the parcel able user application object
